creator: ricardo.lorenzo@whitebearsolutions.com
text:
When we try to publish a document, Cocoon show de following error:

org.apache.cocoon.ProcessingException: Unable to get transformer handler for
cocoon://scheduler/git/authoring/lengua-portuguesa.html.xsl?pipelinehash=-3637131658407547304:
org.apache.excalibur.xml.xslt.XSLTProcessorException: Exception in creating
Transform Handler


column: 50

line: 1

cause: org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: White spaces are required between publicId
and systemId.

location: null

full exception chain stacktrace[hide]

creator: andreas@apache.org
text: I can't reproduce this. Anyone else?
it does not seem to be 1.4 related....
creator: nettings@apache.org
lenya5@mordent.com
text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> I can't reproduce this. Anyone else?

This happens to me too.  I deployed lenya under oracle app server and get the
same error.  It worked under tomcat but not oas.  We're on lenya 1.2.4.

creator: lenya5@mordent.com
text:
(In reply to comment #3)

Actually, this seems to happen on linux no matter what app server I use.  We
were able to get our pub to publish on solaris with jdk1.4.2-13 and tomcat. 
However on Redhat linux with the same jdk, we can't publish with either tomcat
or oracle app server.

creator: nettings@apache.org
text:
i think the best solution to get 2.0 out is to create one doctype to feature
bxe, and a full-xhtml doctype that will allow tiny and fck to shine... wdyt?
